title: US suspends military aid to Ukraine effective immediately
summary: Donald Trump announced Monday that the US would pause its assistance to Ukraine following a tense Oval Office meeting, signaling a shift in strategy as he pressures Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky to engage in peace talks with Russia.

title: Global obesity crisis: 60% of adults and one third of children could be overweight by 2050, warns new study
summary: A study published on Tuesday in 'The Lancet' warns of the escalation of the obesity and overweight pandemic if no action is taken to reverse the trend. The increase would particularly affect Asia and Africa.

title: Trump's newspeak: A semantic war in the federal government
summary: In just a few weeks, the US president has embarked on an impressive lexical blitzkrieg with strong ideological content.

title: Trump confirms 25% tariffs on Mexico and Canada will begin Tuesday, sending stocks tumbling
summary: US President Donald Trump confirmed that starting Tuesday, 25% tariffs will be imposed on imports from Mexico and Canada, raising fears of a trade war. The move, which the US claims targets drug trafficking and trade imbalances, has already rattled markets and prompted retaliatory warnings from both nations.

title: Switzerland raises concerns over handing pension fund management to US banks
summary: Some Swiss pension funds are managed by American banks. Washington's geopolitical U-turn now calls into question the prudence of this choice.

title: The mustache's comeback among under-30s: 'It gives you a light and comic dandy style'
summary: The mustache is making a strong comeback among millennials, who were thought to be immune to this last century accessory. Long a symbol of virility, it now lends itself to all manner of interpretations, far from the old clichés.

title: 'Let's defend science against anti-knowledge efforts.'
summary: Echoing the American protest movement against Donald Trump's policies, a collective of prominent French figures is calling on citizens and scientists to join the 'Stand up for Science' movement, as well as a national day of action on March 7.

title: Pope Francis suffers two episodes of 'acute respiratory failure'
summary: The Holy See said in its usual update that the pope had resumed the use of an oxygen mask and noted that he was 'alert, focused and cooperative.'

title: US Senate confirms Linda McMahon as Education Secretary amid uncertainty over department’s future
summary: Linda McMahon, former wrestling CEO, was confirmed Monday by the US Senate as the Education Secretary, a position that puts her at the helm of a department President Trump aims to dismantle. McMahon’s confirmation follows Trump’s promise to decentralize education, pushing power back to state governments.

title: Cryptocurrencies: Trump outlines a US 'strategic reserve' ahead of a 'crypto summit'
summary: In addition to Bitcoin and Ethereum, the American president has promised that other cryptocurrencies, originating from American initiatives, will become part of the stock managed by the federal state.

title: Switzerland raises concerns over handing pension fund management to US banks
summary: Some Swiss pension funds are managed by American banks. Washington's geopolitical U-turn now calls into question the prudence of this choice.

title: Trump renews attack on Zelensky after Ukrainian leader says end of war 'very far away'
summary: Donald Trump was responding to comments made by the Ukrainian president, who accused Russia of not being serious about peace in Ukraine.

title: French ex-surgeon says he is 'ready to admit' to some rapes at mass child abuse trial
summary: Joël Le Scouarnec, who is accused of raping or assaulting 299 patients, had admitted to some rapes of boys during the investigation, but had denied the rapes of girls he had written about in his diaries.

title: Egypt's double-dealing in Gaza
summary: The Egyptian regime is perhaps reaping too many benefits from the prolonged conflict in Gaza to make a meaningful contribution to ending it, writes Jean-Pierre Filiu in his column.

title: 'China exports not only steel, cars and social media, but Starbucks competitors too'
summary: The bubble tea specialist Mixue, which has already expanded into 11 countries, recorded the largest IPO on the Hong Kong Stock Exchange since 2021. The craze has a lot to do with the arrival of investors from mainland China, hitherto little present in Hong Kong, writes Le Monde columnist Philippe Escande.

title: Two dead, several injured in Germany as car rams into crowd
summary: Local police said a suspect was in custody after a car hit a group of people in the western city of Mannheim on Monday.

title: 'Anora,' Sean Baker's erotic Cinderella story, wins best picture at the Oscars: 'Long live independent film!'
summary: In personally winning four Oscars on Sunday at Hollywood's Dolby Theatre, 'Anora' writer, director, producer and editor Sean Baker tied the mark held by Walt Disney, who won for four different films in 1954.

title: Zelensky celebrated in London but criticized again in Washington
summary: The Ukrainian president, whose departure seems to be the wish of part of the American administration, was received by King Charles.

title: 'France's conversion to wartime finances is a reality, but it is taking place without any consensus'
summary: Marine Le Pen's stance on the Ukrainian conflict reinforces the rift between Europeans and nationalists. There is no national unity on any method or goal, observes Le Monde columnist Françoise Fressoz.

title: The Rio Carnival is an economic and tourism boon for Brazil
summary: The festivities, which take place in Brazil from February 28 to March 8, attract tens of thousands of people and generate considerable revenue, particularly for the textile and tourism industries.

title: Calls for boycotting US products spread in northern Europe
summary: While tens of thousands of people have joined Facebook groups in Sweden and Denmark calling for no longer buying American, Norwegian company Haltbakk Bunkers has announced that it will stop supplying US military vessels with fuel.

title: Scale of child rape in Sudan widespread, UNICEF says
summary: The United Nations say sexual violence against children is being used as a war tactic in a widespread manner in Sudan. Millions are at risk, according to a new report.

title: Cécile Alduy: 'The exchange between Trump and Zelensky was not a slip-up, it was a proclamation'
summary: After the altercation between the American and Ukrainian presidents in the Oval Office of the White House on February 28, the French literature professor analyzes the break with traditional diplomatic scenography spurred on by Donald Trump.

title: Ariane 6: Europe's rocket launch postponed due to 'anomaly'
summary: A 'dysfunctional valve' was detected minutes before the scheduled launch on Monday of the rocket, which is to carry a French military satellite into space.

title: Trump brutally freezes US military aid to Ukraine to force Zelensky into ceasefire
summary: The White House has decided to suspend all deliveries of arms and munitions to Kyiv. The aim is to compel the Ukrainian president to accept an unconditional ceasefire and apologize after the heated discussion in the Oval Office.

title: Trump sows political and financial chaos by imposing tariffs on Canada, Mexico and China starting Tuesday
summary: Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau announced retaliatory tariffs on US products as early as Tuesday, Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum insisted that Mexico had 'a plan A, a plan B, a plan C and a plan D,' and Beijing announced 'countermeasures.'

title: EU chief unveils €800 billion plan to 'rearm' Europe
summary: European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen on Tuesday presented a five-part plan to strengthen Europe's defense industry and provide 'immediate' military support to Ukraine.

title: EU must do 'balanced deal' with US on tariffs, says French finance minister
summary: Eric Lombard described the negotiations as 'tough' on French radio on Tuesday, but said it was important to keep a 'cool head,' adding 'the European Union is the United States' first market.'

title: In Ukraine, the reality of becoming a parent during war
summary: For the past three years, Sasha Kurovska, from Kyiv, and her sister Olga, in Paris, have been recounting how their lives have been turned upside down by the Russian invasion. In 2024, they each gave birth to a son, despite a future as bleak as ever. Today, Sasha lives with an unbearable anguish: the possible mobilization of her partner.

title: Jean-Louis Debré, former president of France's Constitutional Council, dies at 80
summary: A lifelong Gaullist and a loyal follower of his mentor Jacques Chirac, Debré served as a much-appreciated president of the Assemblée Nationale before ending his long political career as president of the Constitutional Council.
